16. TERMINATION
A) Either party may terminate this agreement by giving written Notice to the other party if:
i) The other party fails to perform or satisfy any of the conditions, covenants or obligations of this Agreement.
ii) The other party files or has filed against it, a petition seeking relief under any bankruptcy, insolvency, reorganisation, moratorium, liquidation or  similar law affecting creditors' rights
B) In addition, Lucid may terminate this agreement by giving the Distributor Written Notice if there is any change of control, ownership or  management of the Distributor.
C) Either party may terminate this agreement by providing Ninety days Written Notice.
perturbation.changed_text:
16. TERMINATION
A) Either party may terminate this agreement by giving written Notice to the other party if:
i) The other party fails to perform or satisfy any of the conditions, covenants or obligations of this Agreement.
ii) The other party files or has filed against it, a petition seeking relief under any bankruptcy, insolvency, reorganisation, moratorium, liquidation or  similar law affecting creditors' rights
B) In addition, Lucid may terminate this agreement by giving the Distributor Written Notice if there is any change of control, ownership or  management of the Distributor.
C) Either party may terminate this agreement by providing Ninety days Written Notice.
D) Notwithstanding anything to the contrary in this section, the Distributor may terminate this agreement at any time, without cause, upon thirty (30) days written notice to Lucid.
perturbation.explanation: This change introduces a contradiction regarding the termination timeframe for the distributor. Clause C states that either party may terminate by providing Ninety days written notice. But new clause D states that the distributor may terminate the agreement at any time, without cause, upon thirty days written notice to Lucid. This creates an in-text contradiction, as the two clauses provide different termination timeframes for the distributor.
